step.context: x^2 + 2x +5 = \left(x+a\right)^2 +b^2, a,b \in \mathbb{N}\\ \text{What are a and b?}
step.reason: \begin{align} x^2 + 2x +5 &= \left(x^2 + 2x +1 \right) + 4\\ &=\left(x+1\right)^2 +2^2 \end{align}\\ \text{Compare with }\left(x+a\right)^2+b^2 \text{ and it's obvious}\\ \text{that }a =1 \text{ and }b=2

\int \dfrac{dx}{x^2+2x + 5} =\int \dfrac{dx}{\left(x+1\right)^2 + 2^2},\text{if } x +1=t,\\ \text{then }dx =dt.\\ \implies I = \int \dfrac{dx}{x^2+2x + 5} = \int \dfrac{dx}{\left(x+1\right)^2 +2^2}\\ \implies t \left(x\right) = \left(x+1\right) \text{ and }c =2\\ \text{Moreover }t=0 \text{ when }x =-1\text{ and }t = 2 \text{ when}\\x=1.\\ \therefore A =\int_{-1}^{1}\dfrac{dx}{x^2+2x+5} = \int_{0}^{2} \dfrac{dt}{t^2+2^2}
